text.text: How do I initiate the process of posting a write-off for a specific claim?

text: To post a write-off, you can enter the claim number in the search field and then click the claim number in the search results. On the Claim page, click the Running claim balance tab and then click the Adjust balance button. When the Adjust balance window opens, write-off is automatically selected as the adjustment type. You can then click the Description field and select a description from the list. You can also enter the adjustment amount for each HCPCS. The new balance will display at the bottom of the window. Click Post now. You can view the write-off in the Credits, Running Claim Balance, and Running Charge Balance tabs on the Claim page.

text.text: Where can I find the option to adjust the balance and post a write-off for a claim?

text: To post a write-off, you can enter the claim number in the search field and then click the claim number in the search results. On the Claim page, click the Running claim balance tab and then click the Adjust balance button. When the Adjust balance window opens, write-off is automatically selected as the adjustment type. You can then click the Description field and select a description from the list. You can also enter the adjustment amount for each HCPCS. The new balance will display at the bottom of the window. Click Post now. You can view the write-off in the Credits, Running Claim Balance, and Running Charge Balance tabs on the Claim page.

text.text: Can you explain the steps involved in posting a write-off for a claim?

text: To post a write-off, you can enter the claim number in the search field and then click the claim number in the search results. On the Claim page, click the Running claim balance tab and then click the Adjust balance button. When the Adjust balance window opens, write-off is automatically selected as the adjustment type. You can then click the Description field and select a description from the list. You can also enter the adjustment amount for each HCPCS. The new balance will display at the bottom of the window. Click Post now. You can view the write-off in the Credits, Running Claim Balance, and Running Charge Balance tabs on the Claim page.

text.text: What options do I have to select from the description list while posting a write-off?

text: When the Adjust balance window opens, write-off is automatically selected as the adjustment type. You can then click the Description field and select a description from the list. You can also enter the adjustment amount for each HCPCS.

text.text: How do I determine the adjustment amount for each HCPCS during a write-off?

text: The adjustment amount is the amount of money that is being adjusted for the claim. You can enter the adjustment amount for each HCPCS.

text.text: Where can I verify the new balance after posting a write-off for a claim?

text: You can verify the new balance in the Credits, Running Claim Balance, and Running Charge Balance tabs on the Claim page.

text.text: How can I view the details of the write-off after it has been posted?

text: You can view the write-off in the Credits, Running Claim Balance, and Running Charge Balance tabs on the Claim page.

text.text: What should I do if I mistakenly applied a write-off and need to reverse it?

text: To reverse a write-off, you can click the Credits tab on the Claim page and then click the Reverse adjustment link. On the confirmation window, click Reverse adjustment. You will note that both the original write-off and the reverse write-off displays in the credit block.

text.text: Can you guide me through the process of reversing a write-off adjustment?

text: To reverse a write-off adjustment, you can click the Credits tab on the Claim page and then click the Reverse adjustment link. On the confirmation window, click Reverse adjustment. You will note that both the original write-off and the reverse write-off displays in the credit block.

text.text: Where do I need to go on the Claim page to reverse a write-off adjustment?

text: To reverse a write-off adjustment, you can click the Credits tab on the Claim page and then click the Reverse adjustment link. On the confirmation window, click Reverse adjustment. You will note that both the original write-off and the reverse write-off displays in the credit block.

text.text: What action do I take to initiate the reversal of a write-off adjustment?

text: To reverse a write-off adjustment, you can click the Credits tab on the Claim page and then click the Reverse adjustment link. On the confirmation window, click Reverse adjustment. You will note that both the original write-off and the reverse write-off displays in the credit block.

text.text: How can I confirm that the write-off adjustment has been successfully reversed?

text: You will note that both the original write-off and the reverse write-off displays in the credit block.

text.text: Is there any indication on the Claim page to differentiate between the original write-off and the reversed write-off?

text: To reverse a write-off adjustment, you can click the Credits tab on the Claim page and then click the Reverse adjustment link. On the confirmation window, click Reverse adjustment. You will note that both the original write-off and the reverse write-off displays in the credit block.

text.text: What steps should I follow if I need to reverse multiple write-off adjustments for the same claim?

text: To reverse a write-off adjustment, you can click the Credits tab on the Claim page and then click the Reverse adjustment link. On the confirmation window, click Reverse adjustment. You will note that both the original write-off and the reverse write-off displays in the credit block.

text.text: Are there any limitations or considerations I should be aware of when reversing write-off adjustments?

text: If the accounting period in which the transaction was posted is still open, the transaction will reverse in that period. If not, the adjustment will happen in the next open period.

To post a write-off, you can enter the claim number in the search field and then click the claim number in the search results. On the Claim page, click the Running claim balance tab and then click the Adjust balance button.
